channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: General upkeep, 31st August
item.description:
After the Notting Hill Carnival, the pedestrian crossing directional flaps have been pushed making the lights not visible to pedestrians. The carnival attendees also damaged some of the buttons. Some general BAU maintenance is required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishop's Bridge Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George’s flags daubed everywhere, 31st August
item.description:
Flags painted on roundabout… dangerous and illegal. Flags daubed everywhere clearly designed to intimidate. No pride in the country displayed at all. On road signs, bush shelters, telecom boxes. Like a scene from Black Death times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 451, Downham Way, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes obstructing Paddington Station, 31st August
item.description:
Youth attempted to board the Elizabeth line service with line bikes and we refused entry by staff. The bikes are now banned in the primary concourse of Paddington. 19:55 31 Aug 25
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George’s flags causing a distraction on a main road, 31st August
item.description:
You may think this doesn’t cause community tension, but it is really stressful to be intimidated in this way. I was around as a teenager to see what happened to Stephen Lawrence and the same feeling are being stoked up. These flags are nothing short of intimidatory territorial pissings. I’m tense, my family is tense. I can’t trust any white person I see in Bexley. I wont shop in the borough or Orpington anymore. I feel unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 395, Hurst Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress dumped, 31st August
item.description:
Large mattress dumped a couple of metres back from the road under the trees

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverdale Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: St George’s crosses painted on zebra crossing, 31st August
item.description:
Clear vandalism, not an action of pride in this country. Wilfully intimidatory. Notwithstanding the above. Means zebra crossing is not compliant.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 395, Hurst Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loud Music from Speakers every weekend/evening, 31st August
item.description:
There is an ongoing issue, especially on weekends & late night with (usually the same group plus others) with large speakers playing music that rebounds across the park and into the flats and houses around the park. We cannot sleep or get any peace.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downs Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light pollution into private property, 31st August
item.description:
Please can you fix the issue that has been reported early this year The lights installed in the car park for the new development are shining directly into people’s bedroom Please address this as soon as possible Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Street, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Fly-tipping - rubbish bags, mattresses, 31st August
item.description:
This rubbish shouldn't be here, please can you come and clean it up. PS this area, to the side of Wickes, is constant for fly-tipping, please can you add some CCTV to the area to reduce the fly-tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Blackheath Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone has dumped 5 bags of rubble at the entrance to the alley beside No 1 Admaston. This has been here for a couple of weeks and has been left right next to a warning NOT to fly-tip, 31st August
item.description:
I live in this street and am constantly picking up rubbish but I can’t lift rubble.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Admaston Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Base of trees outside salvation army, 31st August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chichester Road, London
